column4: Hi I'm trying to install ubuntu 8.04 on my scsi hdd, but they aren't being picked up in the partitioning part of the install
Are you using 8.04.4 ?
I'm not sure. how do I tell
All I know is that it's 8.04
Did you download the iso recently?
I had the cd sent to me from ubuntu a while ago
Ubuntu releases new CD's with fixes and drivers for hardware that didn't exist or wasn't yet supported in 2008
So does my version not support my hdd's
I don't know, it's possible it doesn't support your motherboard
oh. but a newer version might?
Yes, but I am not sure how likely it is that that is the problem
ok. thanks
Can you pastebin the output of "sudo fdisk -l" from the liveCD?
sorry. I don't know what you mean
Boot into the LiveCD and go to System > Administration > Disks and tell me if your disks are listed there.
I don't see disks under administration
I don't remember the exact name, was there anything in the menu about disks or partitions?
there is partition editor
That's it
it says no devices detected
I would try a newer CD, either the latest 8.04 CD ( 8.04.3 ) or if you don't mind upgrading in around six months 9.10
ok thanks
np
